chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Rashawn L Crawford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is ordered payable as follows:  $763.28 payable to Taqueria El Palmer and $484.11 payable to Landmark Credit Union in New Berlin.  Cash bail applied.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AMENDED 01-19-2017:  CONTINUE to work towards GED or HSED.

No contact with Taqueria El Palmar Restaurant, Culvers and Staffing Partners.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions (treatment, counseling and childcare).
STAYED - to be used at the agent's discretion and agent to determine with or without non working hours.
